group_1.textLeft: Greetings. I am the elder of this village.

group_1.textRight: I apologize for imposing on you.

group_1.textLeft: No, no, the only thing I really manage@around here are the special functions.
I was told that you ladies were friends@of our clan's leader?
Are you familiar with Diviners, then?
I see...!
It was quite the shock to receive word from the@head family after all these years, you know.

group_1.textRight: I've heard Diviners are treated as a superstition@around here. Is it true?

group_1.textLeft: Yes... We haven't had one in the village@in a long time.
But I digress. What was it you wanted@to ask of me?

group_1.textRight: I've heard about a legend of a ship in these waters@that had carried treasures like gold and silver.
Do you know if it's true or not?

group_1.textLeft: Ah, so you've come to seek treasure@as well, yes?

group_1.textRight: *Giggle* Correct. I'm glad you caught on@so quickly.

group_1.textLeft: You're not even trying to mask your greed...
I'm afraid to say...there's no such treasure@around here.

group_1.textRight: What? How can you be so sure?

group_1.textLeft: The story you've heard was likely along@the lines of...

group_1.narration: "Once, there was a girl with magical powers@who ran away with her lover and the treasure@she stole, and they all sank together."

group_1.textLeft: This, on the other hand, is the legend that@has been told in our village...

group_1.narration: "Once, a sailor tricked a Diviner into running away@with him. They both fled out to sea together, but since@the Diviner had abandoned her duties, she was punished@by the gods. The ship sank to the bottom of the sea,@and both of them were killed."

group_1.textLeft: People like you often come here@in search of that lost treasure.

group_1.textRight: I guess there's one thing a lot of us have@in common...

group_1.textLeft: According to tradition, the exact location@of the sunken ship is unknown.
Those who go out to look for it are@prone to accidents.
The currents are rough and fast offshore. Folks@from the village don't dare go near those parts.
I won't stop you...
...but I advise you to stop looking for@this treasure.
Hmm... What do you think, Coordinator?

group_1.textRight: I won't be convinced until I experience it@for myself.

group_1.textLeft: Well, I figured you'd say that...

group_1.textRight: Do you know if there's anyone in the village@who can take us out on the water?

group_1.textLeft: Erm...but I just told you not to look for@the treasure...

group_1.textRight: I don't think there should be a problem if we're@just sailing instead of treasure hunting.

group_1.textLeft: Ain't that just playin' semantics...?
Hrm... Well, if it's a request from a friend@of the head family...
I can arrange for someone to take you@to the ship.
But if anything at all goes wrong,@you will turn back immediately.
